adjectives.description: answerable (comparative more answerable, superlative most answerable)

entries.meaning: Required to justify one's actions (to somebody); accountable, responsible.
examples: Should any Man argue, that  […]  he cannot be justly punished, but is answerable only to God  […]

entries.meaning: (of a question) Able to be answered.
examples: Is my question answerable on basis of the reading alone or does it go outside the information given in the story?

entries.meaning: (now rare) Proportionate; commensurate in amount; suitable.
(rare, of an argument) Capable of being answered or refuted; admitting a satisfactory answer.
